message: How many people would be willing to throw away a weekend for a fun sleepless weekend like this that ALSO live in the area?

The idea is that you would sign up, pitch ideas around 7pm Friday night, and then finish and show off your company, in whatever stage it is, at around 9 to 11 pm Sunday night. You'd be paired off with teammates (how would be decided later) of various skills and pursue a chosen idea. The goal is to learn and make connections with talented entrepreneurial people, not necessarily create the next Google.
Omg this actually sounds like fun. I'd be down but not in the area.
well what are aare you in @drcbarnardo ?
I'd be interested. In Manhattan. A clean hackathon. I'm off to PyCon this weekend, and I suspect a number of people will be at SXSW.
What do you mean by "clean" hackathon @iqbalmohomed ?  And yeah, this would take place in a month or two, I'm judging interest right now.
If it was in PA I might be up for hanging out and learning, using my paltry skills to build. I am located in Greensboro NC but would totally make the trip
I've talked to some other people in the hackerspace. So far people like the idea. I'll be sure to advertise it on Hacker News when we get more information.
So here's a question for those interested - what would you want, need to see ,and what kind of formatwould you look for?

Count me as possibly interested.  I'm in the DC/Baltimore area so I'd have to come up for the weekend but it's not like any of those states are all that far of a drive (well unless it was in upstate NY or something).  I'd probably be more interested in the networking than in developing but who knows - maybe.  Plus my schedule is super impossible all the time.  But I'm certainly interested in hearing more if you move forward with the idea.
Are you a tech person @mridley ? I'm trying to find non tech people to get their perspectives so I can get some insight on how to organize this.
